channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Vegetation overhanging public footpath, 21st June
item.description:
Junction of Greenways / Barnwood Rd : vegetation impedes pedestrians and also significantly restricts the view of traffic from those wishing to cross the busy / fast Barnwood Rd.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnwood Road, Barnwood, Gloucester

item.title: Broken glass on footpath, 20th June
item.description:
Someone seems to have smashed a glass candle holder here, leaving small shards of glass on the pavement. Please could this be cleared up quite carefully, as bits of glass are easy to miss. I'd do it myself but there's nowhere nearby to dispose of the glass. Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 210;212;214;216;218;220;222;224;226;228, Arle Road, Arle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Low drain after tarmacing extremely dangerous, 20th June
item.description:
I am reporting this to you as a matter of urgency. Your labour force was recent tarmacing in the area and patching the roads from the Sherdons Golf Centre through Fiddington GL20 7BJ and beyond. Our repairs and servicing garage use that road every day for test driving cars after work has been carried out on them, along with sales cars whereby customers are test driving cars on the same route. I’ve lost count how many times we’ve hit the low drain (minimum 200mm below surface level) doing c.30mph and it feels like you’ve buckled a wheel, or worst smashed it, because it’s a minimum of 200mm too low. It’s incredulous how the labour force who carried out the work though it would be OK and safe!!!! It has left that stretch of road extremely dangerous, because you don’t have to imagine too hard that a person could lose control of their car after hitting that “dip” in the road, it’s also unavoidable if another car it coming the opposite way at the same time. I’ve attached some photographs to show you and you’ll see how ridiculous and dangerous it is, let alone drive over it at 30mph or more. If nothing is done by this in the next 7 days I will be making a claim for multiple damaged and buckled alloy wheels, which I may do anyway because they certainly are damaged having hit the ridiculous low drain. Any fool could see the drain should have been raised when tarmacing commenced and the tarmac levelled into it. I have a background in Civil Engineering so I talk with extensive experience. I look forward to hearing form you in the next 24 hours. Paddy van der Moyle 07522136314

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashchurch Rural, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bad flooding on new cycle path, 20th June
item.description:
There is large and deep flooding on the new cycle path on the B4063 opposite Briarfields Park. Almost impassable by bike and terrible for pedestrians. Whole section needs a drain installing or relaying.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Golden Valley, Cheltenham

item.title: Road mirror very dirty, 19th June
item.description:
Not sure who would be responsible for this but the traffic mirror to aid driver viewing is dirty and makes it very difficult to see. Had a near miss the other evening as I couldn't see who was coming from the other directions. Would be grateful if it could be cleaned please. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Hill, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Way through hedge overgrown, 19th June
item.description:
Brambles have overgrown the passage through from Campden Road to the A40. This happens about this time each year. Please could you arrange for them to be cut back? Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Campden Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath off Salisbury Avenue is overgrown and impassable, 19th June
item.description:
The footpath from Salisbury Avenue to Lichfield Drive is overgrown with weeds and impassable due to stinging nettles. Three residents have raised this matter with me.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faulty road surface, 18th June
item.description:
Faulty road surface due to heavy traffic that has damaged and lowered considerably the road level leaving standing water and debris which in turn is causing damage to my vehicles when other vehicles drive through it at any speed above a crawl. Buses , lorries and agricultural vehicles driving on the path have damaged the kirbstones also.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Dark Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Garden Fire, 16th June
